title: Kim Kardashian and Kayne West renewed vows in secret ceremony
text:
Kim Kardashian West and Kanye West renewed their wedding vows in secret this year after their son Psalm was born.

The 39-year-old reality star - who tied the knot with the rapper, 42, in a lavish ceremony on May 24, 2014 - decided to mark their five-year anniversary and the arrival of their fourth child on May 10, 2019 with a special surprise vow renewal ceremony.

During Sunday’s episode of Keeping Up with the Kardashians, Kim told Scott Disick: 'I think it’s so special that all four of our kids are here.

Surprise ceremony: Kim Kardashian West and Kanye West renewed their wedding vows in secret this year after their son Psalm was born, it was reveled on Sunday's episode of Keeping Up With The Kardashians

'It’ll just be really sweet, and I’m excited that everyone is coming over.'

The actual ceremony wasn't shown, but Kim - who also raises children North, six, Saint, three, and Chicago, 17 months, with Kanye - shared the first line from her speech.

She read: 'You are my husband. You are my best friend. My biggest believer and my one true love.'

The family were seen preparing for the al fresco celebrations, dressed all in white with the children wearing flower crowns.

Walk down memory lane: The 39-year-old reality star - who tied the knot with the rapper, 42, in a lavish ceremony on May 24, 2014 - decided to mark their five-year anniversary and the arrival of their fourth child on May 10, 2019, with a special surprise vow renewal ceremony

Cute: While the ceremony wasn't aired, the family were seen preparing for the celebrations with North, six, taking on the role of flower girl

Kim also revealed how Kanye 'stepped up' his game after Psalm was born as she opened up about having 'anxiety'.

She said: 'Things are definitely more chaotic like all the time, but I make it a serious point to spend time with him.

'Kanye knows that I’ve had such anxiety with the new baby and everything going on.

'He’s stepped up so much and has been the most amazing dad, playing all the games with the kids and things like that.'

Expanding their family: Kim also revealed how Kanye 'stepped up' his game after Psalm was born (pictured with son Saint, three) as she opened up about having 'anxiety'

The KKW Beauty businesswoman also revealed that she was planning on calling Psalm 'Ye' at one point, but Kanye - whose name is often shortened to Ye - 'didn't like it'.

It was her half-sister Kylie Jenner who suggested Psalm would work well with Saint.

She said: 'His name was going to Ye, but Kanye didn’t like Ye because Ye it doesn’t mean anything.

'We looked up every name in the bible that had Ye in the beginning, and the only name was Yehezkel, and Kylie called at the last second and was like, "no!2 Pslam and Saint sound good together.'

Intimate ceremony: The event took place outside, with the whole family dressed in white

Kim admitted having four kids has made her feel 'complete' as she gushed about their 'amazing' surrogate.

She said: 'Our surrogate is so amazing. She had the easiest delivery.

'She pushed literally maybe one time. Kourtney and Kanye were in the room with me.

'I feel so complete. I really do feel like four [kids] is the perfect number for me. I feel so full in the best way, but I’m done.'
description: Kim Kardashian West and Kanye West renewed their wedding vows in secret this year after their son Psalm was born.
